excerpt: Geothermal area featuring boardwalks & gravel paths past steam vents & bubbling craters.
detail_description: Craters of the Moon, located just north of Taupo, is a geothermal wonderland featuring boardwalks and gravel paths that lead visitors past steam vents and bubbling craters. The area offers a glimpse into the country's fascinating geothermal phenomena with its geyser fields, steaming vents, roiling mud pots, and hot pools. Visitors can explore the natural high-energy environment while taking leisurely walks along two tracks that provide different perspectives of the landscape.
name: Craters of the Moon
address: 171 Karapiti Road, Wairakei, Taupō 3377, New Zealand

excerpt: Footbridge over a rushing whitewater pool, with views of the 220,000-litres-per-second waterfall.
detail_description: Huka Falls is a breathtaking sight as the Waikato River rushes over a rocky ledge into the gorge below, creating a deafening fury of foam with 220,000 liters of water plunging every second. Visitors can enjoy close-up views from a pedestrian bridge and various platforms or opt for an exhilarating jet boat ride through the turquoise waters to reach the base of the falls.
name: Huka Falls
address: Wairakei, Taupō 3384, New Zealand

excerpt: Picturesque dam opening its gates several times a day to unleash a rush of water down the river.
detail_description: Aratiatia Rapids is a stunning natural attraction located near the Aratiatia Dam. The rapids are created when the dam gates are opened several times a day, releasing a powerful rush of water into the river below. Visitors can witness this breathtaking display of nature's force and beauty from various vantage points along the Aratiatia Rapids Track. The sight of millions of liters of water surging through the rugged landscape is truly awe-inspiring.
name: Aratiatia Rapids
address: 630 Aratiatia Road, Rotokawa 3378, New Zealand

excerpt: Contemporary Maori carvings in lakeside rocks featuring a huge face & smaller figures.
detail_description: The Ngātoroirangi Mine Bay Māori Rock Carvings are a stunning display of contemporary Maori art located on the cliffs of Lake Taupo's Mine Bay. Crafted by Maori carver Matahi Whakataka-Brightwell in the 1970s, the main carving depicts the Maori navigator Ngatoroirangi and stands 14 meters above the water's surface.
name: Ngātoroirangi Mine Bay Māori Rock Carvings
address: Mine Bay, Taupō 3330, New Zealand

detail_description: Lake Taupo is a stunning destination nestled in New Zealand's North Island, offering a variety of experiences for travelers. Motutere Bay provides a unique holiday camp experience with powered and non-powered sites right on the edge of the lake. The camp offers immaculate facilities and beautiful sunset views over the water. Visitors can also enjoy birdwatching, with black swans and other wildlife frequenting the area.
name: Lake Taupo
address: Waikato Region, New Zealand

detail_description: Wairakei Terraces & Thermal Health Spa in the Taupo region is a perfect place to unwind and relax. The geothermally-heated waters of its hot pools are great for soothing tired muscles. The silica terraces filled with mineral-rich waters have been used in Maori healing techniques for centuries. Surrounded by native bush, the spa offers a picturesque view, especially during winter when snowfall adds to its charm.
name: Wairakei Terraces & Thermal Health Spa
address: 671 Wairakei Drive, Wairakei, Taupō 3384, New Zealand

excerpt: Small museum with unique local history exhibits, art displays & a scenic garden with native flora.
detail_description: Taupo Museum and Art Gallery is a small yet captivating destination that offers a diverse range of exhibits and activities. The museum features unique local history displays, art collections, wood carvings, nautical exhibits, and even a vintage Kiwiana caravan from the 1960s. Visitors can explore the vibrant Ora Garden of Wellbeing, which has been praised for its representation of bush and cultural history.
name: Taupo Museum and Art Gallery
address: 4 Story Place, Taupō 3330, New Zealand

detail_description: The Tongariro Alpine Crossing is a renowned 19.4km track that offers an extraordinary journey through a volcanic landscape in New Zealand. It starts at Mangatepopo Valley near Whakapapa and takes about 8 hours to complete, allowing hikers to witness old lava flows, active craters, emerald lakes, volcanic peaks, and breathtaking panoramic views amid the Tongariro volcanoes.
name: Tongariro Alpine Crossing
address: New Zealand

excerpt: Tours of a prawn farm's hatchery & nursery, with water-related activities such as paddle boats.
detail_description: Huka Prawn Park, located just 10 minutes north of Taupo, is a unique aquaculture venture and tourist attraction. Visitors can take a guided behind-the-scenes tour of the prawn farm's hatchery and nursery to learn about the breeding process. The park offers a variety of water-related activities such as paddle boats, prawn fishing, feeding trout, riding water bikes, and more.
name: Huka Prawn Park
address: 200 Karetoto Road, Wairakei, Taupō 3384, New Zealand

excerpt: Boat-accessible geothermal area featuring geysers, hot springs & mud pools, plus a riverside cafe.
detail_description: Nestled in the Taupo Volcanic Zone on New Zealand's North Island, Orakei Korako Geothermal Park & Cave is a captivating destination for nature lovers and adventurers. Accessible by boat or ferry, this geothermal wonderland boasts vibrant rock formations, steaming geysers, and bubbling mud pools set amidst lush native bush. Visitors can wander wooden pathways through the surreal landscape and even descend into subterranean caves with stunning rock formations.
name: Orakei Korako Geothermal Park & Cave
address: 494 Orākei Kōrako Road, Taupo 3083, New Zealand

excerpt: Geothermal hot pools for bathing & a riverside park with a kids' play area, plus hiking & biking.
detail_description: Spa Thermal Park, located in Taupo, New Zealand, is a popular destination known for its rejuvenating hot springs and geothermal activity. The park offers geothermal hot pools for bathing, a riverside setting with wooden pontoons for easy access to the warm thermal waters, and a kids' play area. Visitors can enjoy the calming pools formed by the Otumuheke Stream combining with the Waikato River.
name: Spa Thermal Park
address: Tauhara, Taupō 3378, New Zealand

excerpt: The 4th National Park in the world, this protected area is important for its culture & its nature.
detail_description: Tongariro National Park, the 4th national park in the world, is a significant protected area known for its cultural and natural importance. It was gifted to the nation by Te Heu Heu Tukino IV, a Tuwharetoa chief, in order to preserve sacred lands from settlement and damage. This act formed the core of New Zealand's first major public reserve and led to its UNESCO World Heritage Site status in 1991 due to its unique landscape and cultural significance.
name: Tongariro National Park
address: Manawatū-Whanganui Region 4691, New Zealand

detail_description: Huka Honey Hive in Taupo, New Zealand is a beloved destination for honey enthusiasts and nature lovers. For nearly 30 years, this local favorite has been showcasing the world of bees and their prized product through its gardens, apiaries, and retail spaces. Visitors can immerse themselves in the entire pollination process by exploring fragrant local flowers, observing bees at work in their hives, and browsing an array of honey-based snacks, drinks, and skincare products for sale.
name: Huka Honey Hive
address: 65 Karetoto Road, Wairakei, Taupō 3351, New Zealand

excerpt: Hiking & camping in a tranquil setting with ancient geothermal features, lots of birds & a cafe.
detail_description: Wairakei Thermal Valley in Taupo, New Zealand offers a tranquil setting for hiking and camping amidst ancient geothermal features. Visitors can explore hot mud pools, ancient rock formations, and the famous Champagne Cauldron. The scenic Wairakei Thermal Walk takes you through native bush and past thermal features like steaming vents, bubbling mud pools, and colorful mineral deposits.
name: Wairakei Thermal Valley
address: Wairakei, Taupō 3384, New Zealand

excerpt: Parachuting from a range of heights up to 18,500 feet, with views of Lake Taupo & Mount Ruapehu.
detail_description: Taupo Tandem Skydiving offers an unforgettable experience, allowing you to parachute from heights of up to 18,500 feet. The adventure provides breathtaking views of Lake Taupo and Mount Ruapehu. With options ranging from 9,000 ft to 16,500 ft, thrill-seekers can enjoy up to 70 seconds of free fall.
name: Taupo Tandem Skydiving
address: Anzac Memorial Drive, Wharewaka, Taupō 3378, New Zealand

detail_description: Otumuheke Stream, situated in Spa Thermal Park along the Waikato River, offers a serene and natural bathing experience. Visitors can relax in warm geothermal waters from the healing mineral spring while taking in views of the forest and the rushing green river. The area provides modern amenities such as a coffee kiosk, lounging platforms on the river, changing rooms, toilets, and lockers.
name: Otumuheke Stream (Spa Park Hot Pools)
address: 281 Spa Road, Tauhara, Taupō 3378, New Zealand

detail_description: Mine Bay, located on Lake Taupo, is home to a striking contemporary Maori rock carving that stands 14 meters tall. Despite being relatively recent, completed in 1980, the carvings are still impressive and worth a visit. Visitors can take a serene cruise from Mine Bay shores to admire the emerald blue waters of Lake Taupo and experience the expansive beauty of the area. The sailing trip with Sail Barbary offers a peaceful and informative journey with great photo opportunities.
name: Mine Bay
address: Mine Bay, Lake Taupo, New Zealand

excerpt: Small, dormant volcano with a hiking trail to the top through forest & pastoral scenery.
detail_description: Mount Tauhara, a small dormant volcano located just outside Taupo on the Taupo-Napier highway, offers a rewarding hiking trail through forest and pastoral scenery. The climb to the top takes about 1.5 hours and provides stunning views of Lake Taupo and incredible 360-degree vistas with snow-capped peaks, including Mt Ruapehu, Tongariro, and Ngauruhoe.
name: Mount Tauhara
address: Tauhara Forest 3379, New Zealand

detail_description: Lava Glass is a unique destination that combines a glassblowing studio, sculpture garden, art gallery, and café. The studio showcases the stunning creations of renowned artist Lynden Over, who draws inspiration from local cultures and volcanic landscapes. Visitors have the opportunity to witness live glassblowing demonstrations on-site. The sculpture garden features over 600 glass art sculptures, including some of the largest blown glass pieces in New Zealand.
name: Lava Glass - Glassblowing Studio, Sculpture Garden, Art Gallery, Café
address: 165 State Highway 5, Wairakei, Taupō 3377, New Zealand

detail_description: After a day of outdoor activities in Taupo, New Zealand, unwind at Taupo DeBretts Hot Springs for a pampering experience. The mineral-rich thermal pools are set amidst beautifully landscaped gardens, providing a tranquil setting to relax and rejuvenate. Families can enjoy the dedicated children's pool with water features. Additionally, the on-site spa offers various indulgent treatments such as local mud wraps.
name: Taupo DeBretts Hot Springs
address: 76 Napier-Taupo Road, State Highway 5, Taupō 3379, New Zealand

detail_description: Nestled between Taupo and Napier, the Opepe Scenic & Historic Reserve offers a delightful family-friendly adventure. With two walking tracks to choose from, visitors can explore the lush podocarp forest on the Northern track or venture to the saw pit on the Southern track. The reserve also features a military cemetery and traces of historical military encounters and timber logging.
name: Opepe Scenic & Historic Reserve
address: Napier Taupō Road, Iwitahi 3379, New Zealand

detail_description: Tongariro River is a popular destination for water-based activities such as rafting and kayaking. Visitors can also enjoy jet boat rides or river cruises to Huka Falls, with the option to sail a yacht to the Mine Bay Maori Rock Carvings. The area's stunning scenery features vibrant turquoise and aqua blue waters that are crystal clear, allowing visibility of the riverbed.
name: Tongariro River
address: Waikato Region, New Zealand

detail_description: The Tongariro Alpine Crossing is a renowned day hike in New Zealand, offering a surreal journey through ever-changing volcanic terrain. Located in the dual-status World Heritage Site of Tongariro National Park, this trail is celebrated for its ecological and cultural significance. Often hailed as one of the best single-day hikes globally, it provides an otherworldly experience with views of semi-dormant volcanoes and landscapes reminiscent of Mt. Doom.
name: Tongariro Alpine Crossing
address: Tongariro National Park, Manawatū-Whanganui Region 4691, New Zealand

detail_description: Orakau car park is the starting point for the Great Lake Trail, a 71km scenic trail open to both riders and walkers, but more suited to mountain biking. Divided into four sections that showcase changing seasonal scenery, it's easily accessible from Kinloch, just a 20-minute drive from downtown Taupo. The trail is graded as intermediate (Grade 3) and covers three main sections: Waihaha, Kawakawa, and Whakaipo.
name: Orakau car park (for great lake trail)
address: 1568/1634 Whangamata Road, Marotiri 3492, New Zealand

excerpt: Comprising 3 peaks, this is the largest active volcano in New Zealand & features 2 ski fields.
detail_description: Mount Ruapehu, the largest active volcano in New Zealand, is a stunning destination with three peaks and two ski fields. The area offers romantic horseback riding experiences at places like Ruapehu Homestead Horsetrekking and Mellonsfolly Ranch/Old West Town. The summit of Mount Ruapehu is snow-covered for much of the year and showcases evidence of past glaciers.
name: Mount Ruapehu
address: Manawatū-Whanganui Region 3382, New Zealand

excerpt: Tranquil, admission-by-donation botanical garden with rare flowers, picnic tables & walking trails.
detail_description: Waipahihi Botanical Reserve is a serene and picturesque botanical garden that offers a glimpse into the abundant plant life of the North Island. The 86-acre reserve features over 2,000 rhododendrons, camellias, and azaleas nestled among native trees and other flora. Visitors can explore themed walking trails to admire specific plant species and enjoy birdwatching opportunities throughout the grounds. A leisurely 1.
name: Waipahihi Botanical Reserve
address: Cnr Hyde Avenue &, Shepherd Road, Waipahihi, Taupō 3330, New Zealand

detail_description: AJ Hackett Taupō Bungy & Swing is a thrilling adventure destination in New Zealand, offering the highest water-touch bungee experience in the country. The bungee plunge takes you headfirst for 47 meters down to the Waikato River, while the extreme swing propels you over the river at speeds of 70 kilometers per hour. This popular attraction is part of Lake Taupo's array of adventure sports activities, making it a must-visit for thrill seekers.
name: AJ Hackett Taupo Bungy & Swing
address: 202 Spa Road, Taupō 3330, New Zealand

detail_description: Located in the stunning landscapes of Taupo, Craters Mountain Bike Park is a haven for outdoor enthusiasts. The park offers an extensive network of purpose-built mountain biking tracks, ranging from beginner to advanced levels, winding through native bush and pine forests. In addition to biking, visitors can explore walking tracks that cater to various fitness levels, providing opportunities to immerse in New Zealand's natural beauty. The volcanic pumice soils allow for year-round riding with excellent drainage properties.
name: Craters Mountain Bike Park
address: Poihipi Road, Wairakei, Taupō 3377, New Zealand

excerpt: Scenic walkway along the Waikato River that leads to viewing balconies overlooking Huka Falls.
detail_description: The Huka Falls Walkway is a picturesque trail along the Waikato River leading to stunning viewpoints of the powerful Huka Falls. The well-maintained path starts at Spa Park, guiding visitors through native bush and along the riverbank with captivating views of the turquoise water. As you approach the falls, you'll be captivated by the thunderous roar of 200,000 liters of water per second rushing through a narrow 3-meter drop.
name: Huka Falls Walkway
address: Tauhara, Taupō 3378, New Zealand

detail_description: Wairakei Golf + Sanctuary is a top-notch golf course in Taupo, New Zealand, that also serves as a wildlife sanctuary. The 18-hole course covers 444 acres of natural rolling countryside and collaborates with the Department of Conservation to provide habitats for native birds and wildlife. As you play through the professionally manicured greens, you'll be surrounded by lush foliage and might even spot some roaming wildlife.
name: Wairakei Golf + Sanctuary
address: 527 Wairakei Drive, Thermal Explorer Highway, 3377, New Zealand

detail_description: Mount Tauhara Car Park is the starting point for a 2.5km track that leads to the summit of Mount Tauhara, a privately owned stratovolcano offering breathtaking panoramic views of Lake Taupo and its surroundings. The moderate to difficult walk takes about 1.5 hours to reach the top, where hikers are rewarded with 360-degree views over Taupo. This challenging ascent provides a great workout and an opportunity to connect with nature while enjoying the stunning scenery.
name: Mount Tauhara Car Park
address: 94 Mountain Road, Maunganamu, Taupō 3379, New Zealand

name: W2K, Great Lake Trail
address: 8W59+2F, Kinloch 3385, New Zealand

excerpt: Taupo, a town near the centre of New Zealand's North Island, is distinguished by its lakefront setting and outdoor sports ranging from fishing to jet-boating. The vast waters of Lake Taupo, a volcanic caldera, drain into the Huka Falls, dramatic, crystal-blue cascades reachable by hiking and biking trails. Surrounding Taupo are hot springs like those filling the Craters of the Moon reserve.
detail_description: Taupō is a charming town located in the heart of New Zealand's North Island, known for its picturesque setting along the shores of Lake Taupo. The area offers a wide range of outdoor activities, including fishing and jet-boating on the expansive waters of the volcanic caldera lake. Visitors can marvel at the breathtaking Huka Falls, with its striking crystal-blue cascades accessible via scenic hiking and biking trails.
name: Taupō
address: New Zealand

excerpt: Museum, aquarium & hatchery dedicated to trout & water ecology, with a kids’ fishing pond.
detail_description: Located just outside of Turangi, the Tongariro National Trout Centre is a must-visit destination for families and fishing enthusiasts. The center features a native freshwater aquarium, a freshwater history museum, and a trout hatchery. Kids aged 5 to 16 can enjoy trying their hand at fishing in the children's pond filled with rainbow trout.
name: Tongariro National Trout Centre
address: 257 State Highway 1, Rangipo 3382, New Zealand

detail_description: Tongariro River Rafting offers a variety of experiences for visitors to explore the stunning Tongariro River. Known as a world-class river for fishing, it is home to prime rainbow and brown trout. The grade 3 rapids are perfect for first-time rafters, providing thrills without extreme drops. Families can enjoy a gentle float trip suitable for children as young as 3 years old, while those seeking more adventure can take on higher grade rapids elsewhere in the region.
name: Tongariro River Rafting
address: 133 Atirau Road, Tūrangi 3334, New Zealand

detail_description: Skydive Taupo offers a thrilling skydiving experience with relaxed and friendly yet professional staff. The facilities and equipment are well-maintained, and the location is easily accessible. Customers praise the welcoming atmosphere and commend the staff for making them feel comfortable and safe, especially for first-time jumpers. The option to capture the moment with high-quality photo and video packages adds to the overall experience.
name: Skydive Taupo
address: Look for the PINK PLANE!, 1465 Anzac Memorial Drive, Wharewaka, Taupō 3378, New Zealand

excerpt: Thermal spa resort with casual accommodations, most with en suite bathrooms, plus kitchens.
detail_description: Nestled near the picturesque Lake Taupo, Taupō DeBretts Spa Resort is a haven for relaxation and family fun. The resort offers a variety of thermal pools catering to both serene mineral soaking and exhilarating water slides. Surrounded by lush greenery and stunning lake views, families can unwind in the warm waters at DeBretts Hot Pools.
name: Taupo DeBretts Spa Resort
address: 76 Napier-Taupo Road, Taupo, Taupō 3330, New Zealand

excerpt: Hiking & biking routes incorporating bridges & tunnels from a historic tramway used to move timber.
detail_description: Pureora Forest Park, located on the western side of Lake Taupo, offers a glimpse into ancient rainforests with towering giants like the Pouakani Totara Tree and the Forest Tower Track. The park's 78,000 hectares are home to native totara, rimu, matai, miro, and kahikatea trees. Hiking and biking routes incorporate historic tramway features while providing access to untouched flora and fauna.
name: Pureora Forest Park
address: New Zealand

excerpt: Scenic spot where visitors aim at a floating golf target with a chance to win a hole-in-one prize.
detail_description: Lake Taupo Hole in One Challenge is a popular attraction where visitors can test their golfing skills by aiming at floating targets on the water. While the chances of hitting a hole-in-one are slim, it doesn't stop people from having fun and trying their luck. For a fee, participants receive balls and tips to improve their swing. The challenge offers the opportunity to win prizes, including $10,000 for hitting a hole-in-one.
name: Lake Taupo Hole in One Challenge
address: 61 Lake Terrace, Taupō 3330, New Zealand

detail_description: Discover the enchanting Tokaanu Thermal Walk, a delightful experience nestled in Taupo, New Zealand. This leisurely stroll typically takes between 30 minutes to an hour and meanders through lush native bushland, where you can witness steam rising from the earth alongside bubbling mud pools and colorful mineral springs. The walk is not only a feast for the eyes but also steeped in cultural significance, as it has been cherished by the local Maori community for generations.
name: Tokaanu Thermal Walk
address: 220 Mangaroa Street, Tokaanu 3381, New Zealand

detail_description: Kinloch Beach, located just 12 miles west of Taupo, offers a picturesque sandy lakefront perfect for various water activities such as swimming, fishing, and boating. Nestled within the Whangamata Stream Scenic Reserve, it provides access to hiking and biking trails amidst lush forests. Once a sheep station, Kinloch has transformed into a sought-after holiday destination featuring amenities like a golf course and marina.
name: Kinloch Beach
address: Kinloch 3377, New Zealand

detail_description: The Huka Falls Mountain Biking Carpark is a spacious new addition to the Craters Mountain Bike Park, offering parking for over 40 cars. While not suitable for campervans or RVs, the carpark provides convenient amenities such as picnic tables nestled under shady trees and two modern toilets on site.
name: Huka Falls Mountain Biking Carpark
address: 415 Huka Falls Road, Wairakei, Taupō 3384, New Zealand

detail_description: Located just outside of Taupo, about a 30-minute drive away, Orakei Korako is a serene and peaceful spot opposite the Orakei Korako Thermal Park. It offers a wooden deck where visitors can relax in the sun with a coffee or glass of wine while observing eels in the water below. This location is less crowded compared to other thermal fields, making it an ideal place to enjoy nature's wonders.
name: Orakei Korako
address: Mihi 3083, New Zealand

excerpt: Ski area offering facilities for all levels, including an extensive beginners' area with a cafe.
detail_description: Whakapapa is a popular ski area located on the northern side of Mount Ruapehu in Tongariro National Park, New Zealand. It offers a wide range of facilities for skiers and snowboarders of all levels, including an extensive beginners' area with a cafe. The ski field covers an enormous 550 hectares of terrain that is accessible by ski lifts and patrolled for safety.
name: Whakapapa
address: Top of Bruce Road, Manawatū-Whanganui Region 3989, New Zealand

excerpt: Family attraction with animals to pet & feed as well as a range of play equipment for children.
detail_description: Lilliput Taupo Animal Park is a family attraction with animals to pet and feed as well as a range of play equipment for children. It's an excellent place for the entire family, with kids loving feeding the animals and parents appreciating the shade and picnic areas.
name: Lilliput Taupo Animal Park
address: 136 Link Road, Wairakei, Oruanui 3384, New Zealand

detail_description: In Taupo, Mind Junction Activity Park is a must-visit for families looking for an all-in-one entertainment destination. With six different adventures to choose from, including mini-golf, puzzles, and flight and shooting simulators, this park offers something for everyone. It's conveniently located just a short drive from the city center and provides indoor activities perfect for any weather.
name: Mind Junction Activity Park
address: 8 Palmer Mill Road, Wairakei, Taupō 3384, New Zealand

detail_description: Whakaipo Bay is a popular spot for outdoor enthusiasts, offering various options for activities such as riding the W2K section in either direction or taking the Headland Loop. The bay provides a serene natural setting with clear waters and picturesque scenery, making it perfect for romantic dates. It has ample parking space for motorhomes and cars, and is known to be safe for swimming in its crisp fresh water.
name: Whakaipo Bay
address: Waikato Region 3385, New Zealand

excerpt: Ski slopes for all abilities on the side of Mount Ruapehu, the highest mountain on the North Island.
detail_description: Turoa is a ski destination located on the side of Mount Ruapehu, the highest mountain on New Zealand's North Island. It offers ski slopes suitable for all skill levels. Accommodation options in the area include campervan and tent sites, standard cabins, and fully serviced campgrounds surrounded by nature. Visitors can also find self-contained units with amenities like showers.
name: Turoa
address: Ohakune Mountain Road, Mt Ruapehu, Ohakune 4691, New Zealand

detail_description: Hukafalls Jet Taupo offers a thrilling 30-minute experience, taking you on a jet boat ride along the Waikato River to the base of Huka Falls. As the only company permitted to provide this up-close encounter with the falls, Hukafalls Jet allows you to feel the force of 300,000 cubic liters of water per second as it cascades over the edge.
name: Hukafalls Jet Taupo
address: 200 Karetoto Road, Wairakei, Taupō 3377, New Zealand

detail_description: When you find yourself in Taupo, don’t miss the chance to experience Rapids Jet, a quintessential New Zealand adventure that promises an unforgettable ride. This thrilling 35-minute jet boat journey takes you through the stunning landscapes of the Waikato River and Huka Falls, culminating at the breathtaking Aratiatia Dam waterfall.
name: Rapids Jet Taupō
address: Nga Awa Purua Road, Rotokawa 3378, New Zealand
